Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay in a Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheLegend1
Reviews.Content: We stayed her in July 2011 so it is late review, but I thought I still write this review as it may help if you are planning to stay. We arrived just after midnight, as our flight was delayed and we also collected our hire car. We stayed here for four nights, as part of an eleven night stay. Check in was a smooth process with no problems. We initially had booked a Dulex Room booked, all paid for and booked through Expedia. However, on check in the Gentleman kindly upgraded us (without asking) to an Executive Room after seeing our child. The Executive room was bigger with a small separate living area which had a sofa bed. Two members of staff who bought our luggage up, also kindly converted the sofa bed into a bed for my son to sleep in. The room was very clean with no issues with housekeeping. Bathroom was also clean with no issues with hot water or cleanliness. I also found the bed comfortable. We had breakfast included in our stay and in my personal opinion I thought it was ok with decent choice. This hotel is the Ascot hotel and there is also a sister hotel called Royal Ascot Hotel. This is next door and is linked internally. I found the staff friendly and had no issues with them. The hotel is on a busy main road, however, our room was on the side of the building and we had no issues with noise. Our room was on the 2nd floor, so we no issue with noise internaly. The only downside was with had a view of the Royal Ascot Hotel, this building was only 10 yards away and the view was not pleasing. It is also right across the road from Meena Bazaar, where there are many cheap Indian Restaurants. There were some issues in other TA reports about ladies of the night. We did not see any nor had any problems. This could be because we did not go to the Bar. Overall this hotel is good, but would be more suited for someone who is going to be out during the day and want a decent place to sleep. This is what we did, so it suited us.

Reviews.Title: “BAAAADDDDDD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: YSARELLE
Reviews.Content: I called to asked about their function room for an orientation & the Lady Receptionist connected me to another line which to my dismay nobody answered. So I called again, same person answered my call & I asked if she's a Filipina, she said yes. I told her that nobody answered the phone & she simply said she/he went home already because it's late night. SHE DIDN'T APOLOGIZE!!!! I asked her if she has any idea how much is it she answered she has no idea & they're not allowed to divulge prices. She further told me to call back tomorrow & I was even the one asking her what time will the person in-charge be available tomorrow. As far as I know, the Receptionist or a Customer Service Staff knows who is charge of inquiries & their respective working time/availability because they're the first person clients will get infos from. The Receptionist was not courteous; not informative; don't know how to apologize; she obviously don't know good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Noise!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mark G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here since Wednesday morning, I have not made breakfast yet as you are kept up until 3 or 4 in the morning with the function room on the 5th floor. After complaining to reception. Still nothing was done!. DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU WANT A GOOD NIGHT SLEEP!!!!. Rooms and service are excellent but apart from that all you want is a good nights sleep after 1 am. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Annashapiro
Reviews.Content: We had a 24hr lay over in Dubai and our airline Emirates customer service desk arranged the hotel for us. Its just an average hotel about a 20 min subway ride away from all the action near the Burj khalifa. The hallways smelled of cigarettes and the low ceilings made it feel claustrophobic. For one night, it was fine, but for a longer stay I would go elsewhere. The front desk staff was kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, but excellent value for money compared to others”
Reviews.Author: rogalina
Reviews.Content: is a basic hotel however staff were wonderful. I found it an excellent hotel if u only want a clean basic hotel for one or two nights, much better then some of the others rated the same.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Petr_Stich
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ascot hotel in December 2011, hotel is clean and comfortable. Free airport shuttle is useful, in our case the car arrived late with no excuse. Hotel staff at the reception was bored and not smiling. Next time we will stay at different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Kitty1955
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay at the Royal Ascot (as shown on our voucher), the 'sister' property next door. We arrived at 5.45am to find that the hotel's records showed our booking was at the Ascot. Did they simply honour our voucher? No. Customer service was non-existent. The receptionist argued and argued and refused to give us the room we had booked and paid for. Said we could take it up with the management (not expected to arrive until 11am) or the local booking agent (also expected to arrive at 11am). With no choice we were given Room 108. It may have been clean, couldn't tell the room was so dark, its window was really close to the next building. And it overlooked 6 or 8 extractor fans or AC fans on the next building, the sound was just like being back on the plane. To be fair when management did arrive at 11am we were moved to a nice room at the Royal Ascot, but there was no apology. The sole redeeming feature of the Ascot is that it shares the rather ordinary Rooyal Ascot swimming pool on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “golden oldies”
Reviews.Author: gingermegs52
Reviews.Content: my husband (70) and I (65) stayed at this hotel for four nights. It has a funny smell about it. We had a spacious apartment which was very clean and serviced daily, even the sheets changed. The lifts are very small. Breakfast was a smogersboard of food, my omelet was made right in front of me, the cook making it could not understand English so I just pointed to the ingredients that I wanted in it. Easy. We ate one night in the Irish restaurant which was just great. Staff were very friendly. Interesting that all the cleaning is done by males.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey. Expect to be woken up at midnight and no sleep unitl 3am”
Reviews.Author: Rayb969
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 2 nights in the older part of the hotel, level 3 at the front. We arrived at approximately 11am after travelling from Athens and were looking forward to a nights sleep. Unfortunately the band in the restaurant on the 5th floor started at midnight and eventually stopped at 3am. I went to reception in my night attire and asked how long we would have to put up with the loud thumping/drumming. I could even hear it at the reception desk. The gentleman at reception was very polite and said that he would contact the restaurant manager and ask him to turn it down. It only got louder. The same thing happened the following night. Our sleep and well being were significantly compromised by a management decision to allow such an event to take place, I would not recommend that anybody stay there until a guarantee is given by management on this web site that you will not suffer from sleep deprivation

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.......”
Reviews.Author: Upupandawaymelbourne
Reviews.Content: if you intend to get to get to sleep before 0300am On arrival at this Hotel at 0200am, the reception staff requested our Passports which would be held by the Hotel and returned to us after breakfast. We had to ask for their return at this time as they had not been offered to us after breakfast. We could here loud "indiginous" music coming from a nightclub within the Hotel which finished at 0300am. On the second day, the room cleaner did not leave any replacement bath towels which were eventually supplied after two phone calls to reception. On the 3rd night, this nightclub came to life at 1100pm with loud thumping continuous music. On complaining to Reception, I was told, "no problem, I'll let the manager know and get back to you". The music did finish, but I never received the return phone call. I complained to the Guest services person (Anastasia) and gave all the details to her. She was surprised by the lack of attention given by the night reception staff and was surprised when we were not offered another room. I don't think moving rooms would have helped this situation as the music was that loud, it would have been heard in Abu Dabhi. (Anastasia) appeared to be quite sympathetic to our complaint and informed us that she would be contacting the Hotel manager by email, especially after I requested a refund for the price of the room for 1 night. She later confirmed that she had sent this email to the manager and would inform us of any update on our request. Needless to say, words do come cheap, as by the time we left this Hotel at 1145pm that night there was no information from (Anastasia) or the Hotel manager in relation to this matter. I would not recommend this Hotel to anyone, particularly to senior citizens or young families. OK for teenie boppers who like to rave until 0300am and have a long lay in. This Hotel did have wifi but at a cost to you, 35 Dirhams for 2 hours, up to 60 Dirhams for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “room was good,no free wifi internet,close to shopping and burdubai”
Reviews.Author: ulagaisutraaasai
Reviews.Content: for the price and the star rating the hotel has,it does not have free wifi even in lounge.the rooms were good with neat bathrooms.the hotel has lot of restaurants,pubs etc. i did not eat/drink here though.The only advantage apart from rooms are that it is very close to burdubai bus station and the khalid bin waleed metro station. It would cost min.fare of 10 dirhams for ataxi to take you to both these places from the hotel but however you can walk to the burdubai station. for all those who would like to get computers and devices there are plenty of wholesale and retail stores just opp.to this hotel. for those who are from india,pakistan there are plenty of restaurants with 5 mins of walk. even asian rest. are in close proximity. there are lot of hotels with pubs and discos near by. i have lived here for 4 yrs before 5 yrs and recently i went on a two days business trip and stayed in this hotel.there is a shopping area called meena bazaar which is just opp. to this hotel where you can shop for clothes,electronics,toys etc.i would recommend this hotel for short trips like not more than 3 days.i had breakfast and it was just ok with limited no of items.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: dreamer051
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during a stopover on our way home from Europe. We stayed 4 nights (the first of which we arrived at 3.00am). On our arrival the hotel staff were helpful, but even the foyer had a musty smell and a was a little hesitant as to what would lay ahead with the rooms. I wasn't disappointed as it didn't get any better! Our room was so small that you hit the wall with your knees while trying to get in or out of bed. The air-conditioner was EXTREMELY noisy and so cold (we were unable to adjust it) that after the first night we just turned it off. We were staying with another two couples, all paying the same, but couldn't believe the difference in the rooms we were allocated. One couple had a suite, three separate rooms, the other had a large entry area and separate bedroom! Ours could have fitted into one of the smaller rooms of the suite. Anyway this aside, you couldn't sleep. There was a disco (or something) which pounded away till early (or late) hours of the morning. It was impossible to sleep until it had finished for the night. Do yourself a favour, DON't stay here!!! The only positive thing I could stay was the Chinese/Thai restaurant in the same building was great, food and service were exceptional and the Irish pub food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: kinnary
Reviews.Content: good hotel with all basic amenities and value for money. centrally located which helps going around the city. also, next door is one of best discotheques of dubai named - elegante. i Liked the rooms which were very good and Disliked outside roadside view.

Reviews.Title: “OUR HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: manjeriramu
Reviews.Content: Ascot is centrally located with all transport and eateries within close walking distance. The rooms are spacious and spot clean. Staff are ever smiling and courteous. Best of all the price tag is something affordable. Oh, what to say about the breakfast, fantastic and delicious! I don't think we have anything negative to mention. It is all ++++++

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: watercare
Reviews.Content: Although the room fit out was OK it had very low ceilings and noisy air conditioning . The bathroom was very small and dated. The outlook from our room window was over a bank of air conditioning units.

Reviews.Title: “smelt really bad....”
Reviews.Author: annerr59
Reviews.Content: We had a stopover for 2 nights on our way back from a European holiday. As soon as we walked in at 3 am in the morning, the damp musky smell was evident in the reception area. Nothing was different in the room either. The second night a very noisy party on the floor above keep us away until 3 am . When I rang reception they said they would tell the manager but nothing changed. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The really bad smell of the whole place made this hotel the worst I have ever stayed in. This is my first review on tripadvisor. I just want to warn other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in heart of 'old Dubai'.”
Reviews.Author: AetMenvacances
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent one night at the Ascot Hotel. It was a good hotel, and the rooms were quite large and roomy, with two separate cupboards meaning more than the usual amount of hanging space. We both thought the hotel was good, but neither of us were blown away either. Little things niggled - for example, there was no tea or coffee facilities in the room. Moreover, in the bathroom, only limited toiletries were offered - with shampoo and body wash being accessible via a dispenser in the shower space rather than in individual bottle. Not big things, but seemed to lend a slightly cheaper air to the hotel than I think it would hope for. Also, as many others have mentioned, there did seem to be some very loud music rumbling through the hotel when we arrived at 1am in the morning. That said, once we shut the bedroom door, we really couldn't hear it. Rooms don't appear to have any views, and we looked over a back alley way and housing area. The hotel does appear to have a number of restaurants and although we did not eat at the hotel, we did take breakfast which was fine. The Ascot is flush against the Royal Ascot and guests at the Ascot are able to use the Royal Ascot's pool and spa facilities. My husband and I enjoyed an evening swim in the rooftop pool, followed by cocktails at the rooftop Chill bar which we both enjoyed after a hot day of sightseeing. Staff at the hotel were all very friendly and helpful and we had no complaints in that regard at all. All in all a solid 3.5-4 star hotel, but nothing earth shattering. Would prefer to stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate, just not luxury”
Reviews.Author: vagabondsydney
Reviews.Content: This was well located to the gold and spice souks. Great exchange rates in the building across the parking lot and vacant lots next door with ATM in same building, 2 mins walk. Two stays one room with separate lounge area, bigger than on our way back, just room for one lounge chair. Clean, tidy, friendly reception staff (mostly) and helpful. Nice Thai/Chinese restaurant, good breakfast. All mod cons and as a sister hotel to the Royal Ascot adjoining, we were able to avail ourselves of all their facilities. Pool, gym etc. Would stay there again. Great beds.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: lynnandystalbans
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was nicely furnished although the bathroom was not fitted particularly well, with a wobbly toilet, and taps that didn't quite reach the basin. This seems to be typical for the area though. The thing that struck me most was how dark the rooms were, being only lit by 2 bedside lamps and a standard in one corner, all with very heavy orange shades. I could barely see to read. It's frustrating that like most hotels in the area they charge you for internet access, and what I really dislike about this one is the charge for water in the room. Surely this should be a courtesy gesture? Good breakfast with plenty of choice, and quite helpful staff. Restaurants over-priced. Pool area in next door Royal Ascot is lovely. I've stayed at the Royal too and would recommend that above the Ascot itself.

Reviews.Title: “RubbishIn A Bucket”
Reviews.Author: fipty801
Reviews.Content: Why do hotels in the Middle East think they have the right to make a copy of one's passport? Anyway, it was asked for and produced, but after check in, the gent who was handling that kind of thing hadn't bothered making a copy, so reception kept it until I asked for it back. The air conditioning in the room was almost louder than the night club around the corner. We asked to be moved because of the noise and the hotel sent a gentleman to check the noise. He was "going to check" and of course, nothing. Technically there was a balcony. Luckily it was covered by curtains. The view was the usual mix of Middle East airconditioners and satellite dishes with cables running for miles and miles. As usual, the internet access fees were quite simply a legal form of extortion. The photos on the website are mainly of the Royal Ascott Hotel next door (don'tget confused!). The roof top bar is non existent and the entire pool area and furnishings are entirely run down. Sunbeds don't even get made up any more (the pool and rooftop bar belong to the Royal Ascott). It may be just me, but I'm not entirely sure vacuming reception at 3pm with what is potentially the world's loudest vacum cleaner is the best way to endear yourself to one's customers. The "Customer Relations" desk appeared to be manned by an Eastern European woman with very little interest in her customers, but seemed pretty enthralled with the phone conversations "back home." Couldn't even be bothered telling us what a reasonable price for a taxi would be from Point A to Point B. While enjoying a meal I thought it would be nice to add some tomato sauce. After attempting to get a "waiter's" attention, I figured it would be easier to fetch the sauce myself. After sitting back down, I opened the bottle and was quickly covered in tomato sauce. Do you know what causes tomato sauce to spurt out of a twist top bottle? The answer is that bacteria grows and causes pressure. So I was covered in bacteria infected tomato sauce! So was the rest of the table and my chair and my shirt and the adjoining tables. I was able to get the attention of a staff member, and he seemed very concerned; about the sauce on the chair next to mine. This hotel is a joke. Do not stay there. A letter detailing our experience and a request for a refund went completely unanswered, so the management is obviously happy to have this review written. The biggest issue with this hotel is that there is so much potential!

Reviews.Title: “BAD is not the word”
Reviews.Author: Geochris
Reviews.Content: The worst reception staff ever. We checked in around 3am. The clerk insists that the check in time is 12am the next day. I had to explain to him that it is past midnight and the confirmation clearly states check in after 2am. He took the passports for the check in.He kept our passports and said it would be ready in an hour as they have to do a police clearance so he will send it to the room in the morning. I insisted I needed it with me. Within a minute the passports were returned. The rooms are extremely small. It reminded me of the cheaper hotels in London with the pokey furniture and bad odours. There was NO COMPLIMENTARY BOTTLED WATER. The furniture is dated and the hotel smells bad. There are wall plugs built into the headbaord of the furniture. There is a night club at the hotel so you can't sleep till 3 am. The staff are unfriendly and have their own priorities. Normally in a hotel, when the doors open and the bell boy sees guests in the lift, he would allow the lift to carry on and bring the luggage in the next lift. Not at Ascot, here the bell boy has the right to trample your feet in whatever manner but just has to get his luggage trolley into the lift thereby squeazing you and everyone else into a little corner. The breakfast is very basic. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. I would rather ask the management to send their staff for training and do something drastically about the bad condition of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grj11188
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the heart of Bur Dubai just minutes from the creek, the gold souk and meena bazar.. The airport is also not too far away and much of Dubai is accessible by short taxi ride.. The rooms were neat, clean and cozy..Breakfast was standard fare but good quality and a good spread..Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: KarenCalisto
Reviews.Content: I just stay at the Ascot Hotel with my friend, we had a very nice experience. The staff was very friendly since the moment we arrived. The hotel is well located, within walking distance to the Creek, the Gold Souk, the Dubai Museum and a mall. Airport is a 20 min ride and we paid around DHS25 witch is not bad, specially if you are sharing with a friend. Even to go on a cab to the mall of the emirates is not bad at all we paid DHS 45 around usd15 . The rooms are very comfortable, clean and nice. If you stay at the Ascot you can use the pool and other facilities of the Royal Ascot, located just next to the Ascot. Breakfast was very good with variety of breads, pita bread, fruits, yougurt, eggs, juice etc everything that you might want The they that we were checking out, since our flight was at night, the shift manager (Angelica I think is her name) was very comprehensive and gave us 4 extra hours with no charge to check out and then they kept our bags till later. I reccomend this hotel, since it was great deal for the money that we paid

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: fairnessUae
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel afew weeks agot to reserve a table @ the Elegante in Ascot and was given a number to call Sam for this,he said there was no need for this and i should just walk in so long as I am well dressed,but when i got there the Ear pierced Indian guy at the door did allow me in despite explaining that I had called and thats why am not on the list. last week again I called the sam guy to put me and a friend on the list,he Said no need again and i reminded him what happened last time."If u get any difficulties please call me "he said.confidelntly we got there and the Indian guy refused again only to call Sam whos phone was off. Last night around 2000hrs i call sam with my issues and ask him to place me on the list he said ok and placed 3 of my friend too..only to getthere an have the same thing happen agiain,called Sam who came to the door and looked dissapointed that we were a group of 4 Africans,hhis excuse was that the rules had changed and had no explanation why in such short notice ..he refused to still let us in and left us there. I could go on and on about how we feel of this place but for sure your staff have no courtesy and the two guys are the biggest racists considering they are expatriats like us.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: PranayNigotiya
Reviews.Content: good hotel with all basic amenities and value for money. centrally located which helps going around the city. also, next door is one of best discotheques of dubai named - elegante.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: priz54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks on a family holiday. the rooms were a very good size and the quailty of furniture was excellent. we did have to wait for a while for our rooms to be made up before checking in however we didnt mind as the lobby was so comfortable. the staff were really friendly. there are no tea making facilities availbe however you can phone and ask for some and they will bring it to you for free!!! everyone is so polite and the location is ideal. in the middle of everything however its not nosy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as promised”
Reviews.Author: thegreattourist
Reviews.Content: The booking service (through an airline) said it was a four-star - it is definitely more like a lower end 3 star. The rooms were large, but skunky/dank. Cheap quality beds, pillows, sheets. I had to wait a long time at the airport for them to drive me to the hotel. It is a bit far from the airport, took about 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and room”
Reviews.Author: anmitch
Reviews.Content: After seeing all of these reviews AFTER I booked the hotel I was a little worried. I had a fantastic time at the hotel. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. The room (bottom line) was much better than I expected with a lounge area and seperate bedroom. Travelling in the middle of summer, A/C was not a let down, dual control for lounge and bed. The Thai restuarant next door was divine, great, attentive service without being crowded. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: ImpulsivePerth
Reviews.Content: As I was only staying four nights in Dubai I went to the Emirates website and booked one of their stopover packages. I selected a mid-range hotel and that's exactly what I got. Having read other reviews I knew to check that I would not be placed below the restaurant where it was reportedly noisy and my room was changed on checkin. Whilst the room was small it was clean and comfortable and met the needs of a single occupant. I appreciated the range of dining options available and the Irish bar. Staff were very helpful and whilst I would rate the hotel as 3 star it was what I expected and value for money.

HotelInfo.Name: Ascot Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Khalid Bin Waleed Road, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
